rules.6x6: Place a digit from 1 to 6 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 2x3 outlined box. Each white circle at the intersection of four cells indicates that there is exactly one consecutive pair of digits in those four cells. Each black circle at the intersection of four cells indicates that there are at least two consecutive pairs of digits in those four cells. Different pairs can use the same digit. Not all possible circles are marked.
rules.9x9: Place a digit from 1 to 9 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 3x3 outlined box. Each white circle at the intersection of four cells indicates that there is exactly one consecutive pair of digits in those four cells. Each black circle at the intersection of four cells indicates that there are at least two consecutive pairs of digits in those four cells. Different pairs can use the same digit. Not all possible circles are marked.
